title: Using FY2024 10-K filings, calculate Palantir's (NASDAQ: PLTR) Enterprise Value/EBITDA using the close price of the 18th November 2025. Do not use adjusted EBITDA. Round your answer to 2 decimal points. Show your calculations, formulas and assumptions.
description:
1) First calculate FY2024 GAAP EBITDA from the 10-K using the formula 
 EBITDA = Income from operations + Depreciation & amortization = $310,403,000 + $31,587,000 = $341,990,000. 
 
 You will find the Income from operations for FY2024 = $310,403,000 from Consolidated Statements of Operations; Depreciation & amortization for FY2024 = $31,587,000 from Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows.)
 
 2) Set EV formula and assumptions: EV = Equity value (close price on 2025-11-18 × total common shares outstanding) + Total debt + Non-controlling interests + Preferred equity − Cash & cash equivalents − Marketable securities
 
 Take shares outstanding taken from FY2024 10-K cover page as of February 10, 2025 which is 2,345,356,506 shares.
 There is no preferred equity
 Operating lease liabilities excluded from “debt,” and (d) subtract both cash & cash equivalents and marketable securities (U.S. Treasury securities classified as current) as a proxy for excess cash. (Share counts as of 2025-02-10; “no outstanding debt” at 2024-12-31; balance sheet shows cash and marketable securities; marketable securities are AFS U.S. Treasuries, current.)
 
 3) Pull EV inputs from the FY2024 10-K: Shares outstanding as of 2025-02-10 = 2,248,950,826 (Class A) + 95,400,680 (Class B) + 1,005,000 (Class F) = 2,345,356,506 shares; Total debt at 2024-12-31 = $0; Cash & cash equivalents at 2024-12-31 = $2,098,524,000; Marketable securities at 2024-12-31 = $3,131,463,000; Non-controlling interests at 2024-12-31 = $91,132,000. (All per FY2024 Form 10-K.)
 
 4) Get the stock close on 2025-11-18: PLTR closed at $167.33 per share on November 18, 2025. (Historical prices, Yahoo Finance.)
 
 5) Compute Equity value (market capitalization) using the chosen share count: Equity value = $167.33 × 2,345,356,506 = $392,448,504,148.98 (~$392.45 billion). (Price from Step 4; shares from Step 3.)
 
 6) Compute Enterprise Value (EV) using the defined components: 
 EV = $392,448,504,148.98 + $0 + $91,132,000 − $2,098,524,000 − $3,131,463,000 = $387,309,649,148.98 (~$387.31 billion). (Debt, cash, marketable securities, and NCI from FY2024 10-K; price/market cap from Steps 4–5.)
 
 7) Calculate EV/EBITDA and round to two decimals: EV/EBITDA = $387,309,649,148.98 ÷ $341,990,000 = 1,132.52× → EV/EBITDA = 1,132.52×. (EBITDA from Step 1; EV from Step 6.)

rubric.criteria: Used GAAP EBITDA and did not use adjusted EBITDA
Compute EBITDA = Income from operations + Depreciation & amortization = $310,403,000 + $31,587,000 = $341,990,000

Use EV formula: EV = Equity value (using the close price on 2025-11-18 × total common shares outstanding) + Total debt + Non-controlling interests + Preferred equity − Cash & cash equivalents − Marketable securities
Operating lease liabilities excluded from debt
Subtract both cash & cash equivalents and marketable securities as proxy for excess cash
Use closing price of the stock on 2025-11-18 = $167.33 per share

Used FY2024 Form 10-K as source for the following financial statement inputs (income from operations, depreciation & amortization, cash, marketable securities, non-controlling interests, shares outstanding, debt)
